explanation: The original line has an issue with integer division. The expression 'int(x/y)' results in an integer division which can lead to incorrect rounding down of the division. To correctly calculate the ceiling of the division x/y, I used the expression '(x + y - 1) // y', which gives the correct integer result of rounding up without needing to use floating-point division.
fixed_code:
x, y = map(int, input().split())
print((x + y - 1) // y + 1)
